text: [Music]
let me let me give you an example and I
don't really have the numbers memorized
but you can get the gist there is an
example pretty common example that's
used that you have a sister that's 20
twin sisters and they're both 25 years
old one sister at 25 saves $2,000 a year
for 10 years until she's 35 okay and
then she stops at 35 and she just lets
that $20,000 grow um till she's 65
meanwhile her twin sister did not save
that whole 10 years she starts when
she's 35 years old at the time when her
other sister quit saving and she saves
$2,000 a year for the next uh 30 years
till she's 65 years old which she saves
a total of
$60,000 do you know who ends up with
more money sister one who only saved
$220,000 compared to her sister who
saved for 30 years u a total of
$60,000 and in fact sister one who again
you know only saved for 10 years almost
has double the amount of money of the
second sister who saved more but waited
longer you know waited 10 years before
she started saving that is the power of
compound growth
[Music]
oh
